@pan3793 It looks good idea :-)
I made ci green at first

BTW, I added it on https://github.com/apache/zeppelin-site/commit/da2424181cb7e907eb2f34afd166db59fcf0f543. I forgot to change the way to deploy the site. I'll also remove gh-pages soon because https://github.com/apache/zeppelin-site already has all the histories.
Is there no ready-made implementation, e.g. in Java or in the Shiro project?
After you commented, I tried to find related code in `javax.security` and `shiro`. I, however, couldn't find a similar one.
ping @zjffdu @Reamer @huage1994
looks like log4j.version is used - I will raise an issue to get it removed
I know it's related to log4j's security issue but I wonder if it's possible to replace all with log4j2 because we might have some log4j1-specific code. Let's keep on eye on the CI first.
Thank you for your first contribution :-) I'll review this PR soon

zeppelin no longer seems to have any log4j v1 internal logging - but does still use slf4j-log4j12

My next aim is to try to get rid of slf4j-log4j12
I left some comments. Could you please check it? Moreover, I think it would be good to have some tests for your contribution.

@jongyoul is this something that could be merged? I know log4jv2 is under consideration but log4jv1 is a really bad thing to have a dependency and it is much simpler to use reload4j. Some of the big Zeppelin dependencies already use reload4j - making it more complicated for Zeppelin to use log4jv2.
built on this for #4719
Hello, thank you for the contribution. BTW, could you please change it to `0.12.0-SNAPSHOT`?

You can add this comment.
```
@dependabot rebase
```

Only Zeppelin committers can do this.
Sorry, only users with push access can use that command.
@dependabot rebase
Ok - looks like this jgit jar only supports Java 11.

ping @zjffdu @Reamer @huage1994

FYI, it's a kind of potential security issue so please review it if you have time.

ping @zjffdu @Reamer @huage1994 
This code will change some malicious code like
```
$ printf %q ';whoami > /tmp/imp.log; date >>/tmp/imp.log;'
\;whoami\ \>\ /tmp/imp.log\;\ date\ \>\>/tmp/imp.log\;%
```

The changes in upgrading Maven plugins and fixing Spark on YARN integration tests make sense to me, while for Livy's part, we can minimize the change by simply adding one `@Disable` annotation on the test class to skip it temporarily and then fix or drop it later with community-level consensus.
The selenium test looks like fails constantly?
Agreed. Adding @Disable first and let's talk about the issue in another thread

done

> The selenium test looks like fails constantly?

I think it is also due to the new Surefire version. But I don't know why. At the same time, I'm working on simplifying the test setup with PR #4726 .
@Reamer @jongyoul could this PR be merged? Zeppelin is breaking ASF rules by using a Category X dependency.

@jongyoul @pan3793 @Reamer could this PR be merged? The ASF is suffering damage to our reputation by having project's who won't use secure libraries - in particular old versions of log4j make us look really bad.
I know that the PR is very big. Does anyone feel able to do a review here?
ping @jongyoul
@Reamer thanks for your help!
> The `SQLException` can no longer be thrown by the `getSqlKeywordsCompletions` method, so the method signature must be adjusted.

@Reamer I figured out why frontend IT failed. Actually, the changes in ZEPPELIN-5848 have some issues, but due to the lower version of the Maven plugin, all JUnit5 tests are skipped.

The real matter is, `AaaIT` creates an instance `BbbIT` in the test cases, and calls `BbbIT#method`, obviously, `BbbIT#beforeClass` won't be called, so that the member variables initialization is skipped, then NPE occurs, I fixed it with minimal changes, the first round CI result looks good (only one case failed, may be a flaky case, let me try another round)
also cc @jongyoul and @zjffdu
Closed in favour of #4734
@Reamer comments are addressed, please take a look again

Superseded by #4744.
Superseded by #4745.
@jongyoul the CI build failure looks possibly unrelated. This is an important security lib - it would be good to get it upgraded to a version that has no CVEs.
I have an idea. In my understanding, `build-tools` aims to run the check style properly. So I think we'd better make a new module for your improvement, instead of using `build-tools`. WDYT?
kindly ping @jongyoul
cc @jongyoul, this is minor issue and I don't think it's a release blocker
Thank you for checking it. BTW, how can we handle it permanently?
I checked the comment on the spark's issue. :-) Thank you!
Thank you for checking it! The CI became green. Let me merge it.
@jongyoul this should be a permanent solution, and the failed test should be irrelevant.

> @jongyoul this should be a permanent solution, and the failed test should be irrelevant.

Yes, I know it. I just wonder why some tests fail :-)
@jongyoul the Python 3.8 test failed consistently, maybe caused by deps dynamic version
cc @jongyoul, this may help
The Python 3.8 test failure should be addressed in #4748
also cc @zjffdu @Reamer @huage1994

You are right, the build-tools module was set up so that the checkstyle reports work properly and we can distribute the configuration cleanly. (see https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-checkstyle-plugin/examples/multi-module-config.html)

I think it is unnecessary to create another module, so I have moved it in there.

It was important to me that the code is contained in a module that is independent of the Zeppelin interpreter modules and the Zeppelin-zengine/zeppelin server.

I can also put the code in a new module. What do you think?
Closed in favour of #4691
@Reamer all failed tests are known flaky tests, this patch should be good to go :)
I will merge the pull request on Wednesday as long as no further comments are received.
Derby 10.14.2.0 is the latest version that supports Java 8

> Derby 10.14.2.0 is the latest version that supports Java 8

After removing Hadoop2, we should now completely remove JDK8 support and focus on JDK 11 or JDK 17.

First of all, I totally agree with you that deciding the code from zeppelin-interpreter and zengine. BTW, I'm a bit afraid of adding more test-related code later in the module. So even if it's not necessary to add a new module this time, I recommend adding a new module like `zeppelin-test` and so on for the future. WDYT?
@zjffdu The Livy test has been broken for a while, and the current approach hardly depends on Livy jars, which also blocks upgrading Spark3 with Scala 2.12, are you good with this direction?
There are a lot of test failures. Let me fix it one by one soon
In the long term, you will probably be right. I have stored the code in a new module.

@flowy0 Hello, you don't have to make a pro for branch-0.11 directly. After the PR is merged, committers can cherry-pick for the commit into release branches. However, the opposite way is impossible. so could you please make a PR that is based on the master branch?

> @flowy0 Hello, you don't have to make a pro for branch-0.11 directly. After the PR is merged, committers can cherry-pick for the commit into release branches. However, the opposite way is impossible. so could you please make a PR that is based on the master branch?
